top_comment.text:
Arrêtez de dire Lolo à tout bout de champ, il est parti c'est fait. On a 
tous apprécié ses vidéos, mais un moment faut accepter le changement. C'est 
super irrespectueux pour les nouveaux créateurs de vidéos ! Imaginez le 
lire les commentaires, faut arrêter un peu. Moi je trouve qu'il est loin 
d'être mauvais, et même si la voix est pas aussi entrainante, il a des 
bonnes idées, et les vidéos ont toujours le même sens humoristique qu'elles 
avaient avant.﻿
top_comment.author: IAwAKsI

comments.text:
Chacun son choix, je pense pas que les vidéos MJ se soient dégradées au 
point d'être sans intérêt après le départ de Lolo, ils font des efforts, et 
ça mérite ses vues. Mais si Lolo n'est plus présent, ils ont voulu garder 
le côté second degré des tests, en étant un peu plus sérieux notamment à 
l'énonciation des caractéristiques. Fin bon, chacun son choix comme je l'ai 
dit plus haut.
comments.author: IAwAKsI

comments.text:
+julien guidi Abuse pas, quand-même. Si ce sont les plus regardées, c'est 
aussi parce que ce sont les plus anciennes, donc elles ont eu plus de temps 
pour être regardées.
Autant j'apprécie les vidéos MJ du temps de Lolo, autant je trouve 
irrespectueux de critiquer ainsi le travail réalisé actuellement. Parce que 
du boulot, il y en a! Et pour un très bon résultat.
Alors, MotoJournal, continuez sur cette voie!!!
comments.author: smala208

comments.text:
Tout à fait d'accord, acceptons le changement, suivons Lolo sur V6 et 
laissons Moto journal à leurs vidéos insipides. Il est fort amusant de 
constater sur le site Moto Journal que les vidéos les plus 
commentées/regardées, restent majoritairement celles avec Lolo... Une seule 
chose à dire : Le peuple a parlé!!!
comments.author: julien guidi

comments.text: Aucune idée...
comments.author: IAwAKsI

comments.text:
complètement d'accord avec toi !
Mais j'aimerais quand même savoir pourquoi il est partit ? une vidéo de 
départ aurait été la bienvenue, à moins que je ne l'ai ratée! Si non, avec 
toute l'affection que lui ont témoignés les fans, qu'est-ce qu'il attends ?
comments.author: TheSkunkdreamer

top_comment.text:

comments.author: kironn anch

comments.text:
Dans cette cylindré, en faisant de l'autoroute et avec le top-caisse et 
surtout les valises, ce n'est pas énorme.
Sur départementales roulantes, sans équipement et en roulant cool, ce peut 
être effectivement deux litres de moins au cent kilomètres.
Avec ma 650 Vstrom, certes moins puissante, dans ces conditions, je tourne 
entre 4 l et 4,4 l au cent

captions.text: Hey ! You like to travel don’t you ?
And do you like heavy trails ?
But you don’t have any money ?
Well you can piss off
Joke ! Suzuki took care of you
This is the new 1000 V-Strom
12 499 € for the standard model
As for us, we chose the Tourer version
Fully equipped: luggage, various protections
All of this for a mere 14 599 €
Hey ! Cheaper than a basic 1200GS and it’s all equipped
You like it ? Beautiful isn’t it ?
You got yourself a deal
Just give me 50€ so I can get some gas
and it will be yours for a nice tour
Don’t you move from here ok ?!
The first con to travel for cheap
is to scrounge some money to your half-wited friends
Keep focused though
Because over the 2500 km journey through
the most beautiful landscapes in France
We offer you a whole set of tricks to wander
while spending the fewer money possible
When willing to quit a large city
the easiest way stays the highway
And on high speed roads the Suzuki does really well
Comfortable riding position
Well drawn seat that could possibly be softer
And an absolutely reasonable protection
Careful though the tallest of you will have to pull the windshield up to its maximum level
Or will otherwise have to face turbulences on the helmet
As for the engine, at 130-140 km/h
it runs nicely around 5 000 RPM
for an average consumption of 6.9L per 100km
Not bad at all considering how much
The cases must damage the V-STROM aerodynamics
Still the highway isn’t free
unless you are creative
get through a lane reserved to maintenance vehicles
needs a blowtorch or a bolt cutter
Stick to a car to get through the toll for free works at first
but two weeks later you get this
The cleverest is still to wait for your prey
on a highway rest area
To knife your way in
And there you go, unnoticed
you’re good to go
No motorway fees, no gas fees, no tire use
It’s flawless victory
On the other hand you travel for free sure
but the view isn’t so great
Really crappy in fact
And it’s dumb
As France is overflowed with sumptuous landscapes
Excellent at riding, lightweight and maneuverable
The DL has the trail spirit
The one that allows you to swallow tons of kilometers
on any kind of road
That allows you to stack hours on the saddle
without getting exhausted
In short, to travel without racking your brain over
By the way
while its rival are gone in a terrible technologic-gear escalation
The V-Strom chose simplicity
Adjustable traction control
ABS braking
A 12V socket
A handlebar controlled dash
Needless to do more
Add to this The Tourer version assets
including complementary luggage
A larger windshield
Hand protectors
A central crutch
And you get the impression of eating at the Fouquet’s
for the price of a Best of menu
Speaking of money
here are our tricks to road-savings
Take good advantage of mountain passes to get in freewheeling
It’s fun in addition
Climbing does not work
Suck gas out of a car…why not
but there’s the risky side of it
Hey buddy ! need some help ?
It’s wasn’t me !
The best in our opinion
is to cut through the fields
It reduces the distance to go
And it’s a trail between our legs
why not make the best of it ?
2 helmets for the price of one ? Cheap !
Possibility to disable the traction control
Rather natural standing position
A mere 226kg weight
Suspensions erasing efficiently bumps and holes
That’s all good
And without being an enduro bike
The DL swallows battered fields in a blink of an eye
We have to admit it
The favorite using panel of modern trails stays the road
This long path that we devour from sunrise till dawn
This tar way carrying us to worlds of freedom
This celeste asphalt ribbon…
Hey woah ! I’m losing it !
Maybe it’s time to take a break
Since when getting into a long journey
there’s always one existential question
Hey ?! Where do we sleep tonight ?
The cheap hotel lost in the middle of nowhere
A good solution: 92 € the night for two lunch included
Not bad but we can get better
The tent: yes quite clever
It’s cheap yeah but not comfortable and there’s the insects
Invite yourself at your parents home up in the mountains
yeah ! That’s an idea
It’s just that they did not get that you are a grown-up yet
Come on ! you have to eat it all sweetie pie
No ! We said no sweetie pie in front of the camera
Not mentioning the childhood souvenirs
exhibited by you beloved mom
Oh ! How cute was he at this age
But he had a little defect, it was on his willy
To avoid this kind of episodes slightly shaming
Only solution: not to sleep
especially when driving the Suzuki by night
is far from being a pain
The headlight is top
thanks to a large homogenous beam
brightening the side of the road well
Enough to make it to the next day
We can then benefit from the Alps landscapes
and the sinuous roads getting along with it
The V-Strom is here delighting with its light front-grip
Easy ! it just take a glance at a curve
to make the Japanese get into it willingly
Swift in angles shifting
Stable in large curves
The DL is at ease everywhere
As for the braking: nothing to mention
Well yes
that Suzuki has placed the 2011 GSX-R 1000 calipers
on its heavy trail
Good endurance, good feeling
We can enforce the riding pace in all quietude
Knowing that in an emergency case
you got what it take to stop the beast in your hands
Finally, regarding the engine
this one develops 107hp for a 10.3mkg torque
that it reaches at only 3 700 rpm
In short the large twin was made to rev up at mid-range
and plays its role well
However, we regret that the temper is not that strong
A hotter engine wouldn’t have displeased us
But such a linear character
offers an advantage in terms of consumption
And if riding really easy
you can even flirt with the 5.0l per 100 km
Yep ! The Suz has a small appetite
Which is not the rider’s case
as traveling builds-up appetite
To eat for cheap you can always bet on hunting
but it’s not that easy
Begging for money ?
♪ I’ve no more fuel in my bike and I’m starving too ♪
Yeah but if you’re caterwauling
it’s gonna take some time
You tightwad !
No no, honestly I only see one solution
Hey it’s done ! I found the ultimate way to travel for free
And moreover, I’m housed and fed tonight: Perfect !
Get a move on Nestor !
On the Suzuki V-Strom 1000
We liked
The light and sharp front grip
The valiant engine
The front brake, powerful and manageable
The simple and not overflowing style of the bike
And the price
We disliked
The firm seat on long distances
Some ill-finished details
And the slightly dull engine temper at our taste

title: Essai hors-la-loi : voyager gratos en Suzuki V-Strom 1000 (English Subtitles)
